page.title: 14ADVANTAGES OF RURAL LIVING
page.content: The most common response to a small- sample,school-initiated questionnaire concerned the{environment}of{Bleasby {and Thurgarton}:pleasant,peaceful, attractive,lovely countryside,open- spaced,away from the town and,particu- larily,healthy. Children's health and safety were raised too.{Village { atmosphere}was noted "in which one could "turn-off" in the evenings and at weekends."Comments were also made about the Community spirit;"nice" people,active co-operation,socialising ,and everyone{knowing each other}and being friendly. Some liked the local { schools},both Primary and Secondary. Listed also in various forms was that it wasn't too far to town and that the villages were central between the A1 and M1.Then there was scope for walking and being on one's own.Sadly, for one person, there's{no advantage.
